BasicDescription.Title: Despatch Box
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Political discussion analysing the day's events in Parliament.

BasicDescription.Title: In Pursuit Of Pleasure
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. At Home: The lives of two very different Georgian ladies illustrate the new freedoms and opportunities that opened up for women during the 18th century.

BasicDescription.Title: Open Advice
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Study To Succeed: How do you become a better student? Find out from good practice, excellent teaching and by reflecting on your own learning.

BasicDescription.Title: Declining Citizenship
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Over the last 20 years the position of pensioners relying on the state pension has declined significantly. What has been the pensioners' response?

BasicDescription.Title: PSHE: ID Citizenship
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Secondary Schools. Drama documentaries exploring issues of rights and responsibilities. Then, Offside, a drama exploring peer pressure, masculinity and racial tensions in multicultural Britain.

BasicDescription.Title: Work Talk 3: Germany
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Languages. Essential language basics for working in Germany.

BasicDescription.Title: Working For Yourself
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Using The Cybermarket: How to market and build the brand of small businesses, and how to go global and increase both turnover and profit.

BasicDescription.Title: West Africa: Art And Identities
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. African artists in London and Ghana look at their art and its origins and influences.

BasicDescription.Title: Ever Wondered?
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Fashion Writer Caryn Franklin explores the merger between high art and the high street.

BasicDescription.Title: Rotten Ralph
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. I Know What You're Doing This Summer: Sarah's going to Summer Camp and Ralph is desperate to go along. The question is can he survive without his creature comforts?

BasicDescription.Title: The Raccoons
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Strictly By The Book: More adventures from the Evergreen Forest with Bert and Melissa Raccoon and best friend Cedric Sneer, the son of awful aardvark Cyril Sneer.

BasicDescription.Title: Jeopardy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. A gripping series following the experience of a group of lucky winners from Falkirk High School in Scotland who travel half way round the world to Australia in search of UFO's.

BasicDescription.Title: CBBC At The Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Catch up with the latest happenings and the juiciest gossip from the Academy.

BasicDescription.Title: Ace Lightning
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Nobody's Hero: Helping Ace save the world is taking its toll on Mark, and his parents have grounded him for poor grades.

BasicDescription.Title: The Wayne Manifesto
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Where's Wilson?: Wayne is asked to judge a cake baking contest by Violet, but he has to get out of triple detention first!

BasicDescription.Title: Clifford The Big Red Dog
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. The Dog Who Cried Woof: After overhearing Samuel tell the kids a scary story about Whiffy the Skunk Ghost, Clifford and T-Bone get a bit spooked.

BasicDescription.Title: Noddy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies: Noddy Has A Bad Day: Not every day is a quiet day in Toyland, but then life would be really boring if it was. Noddy and his friends will always come to the rescue.

BasicDescription.Title: Pablo The Little Red Fox
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Snow Fox: The garden is covered in snow so the hungry cubs have an adventure in the park trying to find something to eat.

BasicDescription.Title: Fimbles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Radio: When Pom finds a radio, she's delighted to hear her favourite song. There's something for everyone on the radio. W/S. Followed by Teletubbies Count To Christmas.

BasicDescription.Title: Pingu
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Pingu Gets A Bicycle: Another adventure with that lovable and sometimes misunderstood little penguin, Pingu.

BasicDescription.Title: Tweenies
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Bella, Fizz, Milo and Jake find out about brass instruments and Bella and Brass Notes perform their latest song.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Book: Tweenies - The Wobbly Jelly Hunt

BasicDescription.Title: Teletubbies
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. My Dad's A Policeman: A little boy's daddy is a policeman, he shows us his uniform and badges. Then, the Teletubbies are sitting at their table when they hear a funny noise.

BasicDescription.Title: Birthdays
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Will your birthday card be among today's colourful selection?

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Come Outside
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 4-5] Useful Holes: Auntie Mabel sees a mouse living in a hole in her kitchen and decides to visit the woods to see some other holes occupied by badgers, squirrels and woodpeckers.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Numbertime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 4-6] Money. Up To Two Pounds: Little Juan has organised a charity concert to raise money and El Nombre counts the money. Bill and Bernie go on a boat trip.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Words And Pictures Plus
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 5-7] The Snow Lambs: Paul Ewing presents the final programme of the term, which includes a visit to a hill farm and the story The Snow Lambs, by Debi Gliori.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: What? Where? When? Why?
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 6-7] Technology. Things We Wear. Suitable Suits: The Happy Gang design, create and discover things we need for all sorts of jobs.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Cats' Eyes
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 5-7] Movement: The human body is a wonderful thing and to prove it Shauna visits a Native American 'pow-wow', where the dancers stretch their bodies to the limits.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Cats' Eyes
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 5-7] Survival: Alf the pizza man discovers there's more to survival than eating pizzas, and his needs turn out to be remarkably similar to that of a sea cow.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Maths Challenge
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-10] TV Workout. Large Numbers: Join in another maths challenge as Doctor Strangeglove sets questions on Large Numbers.

BasicDescription.Title: Working Lunch
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Business, consumer and workplace news from the award-winning team who tell it like it is. With Adrian Chiles, Adam Shaw and roving reporter Rob Pittam.

BasicDescription.Title: Snooker: UK Championships
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The quarter finals get underway at the York Barbican Centre this afternoon. Ray Stubbs introduces live coverage and is joined in the studio by Steve Davis and John Parrott.

BasicDescription.Title: Westminster Live
BasicDescription.Synopsis: An update on the day's events in Parliament, plus your chance to question the politicians. Phone 0345 514614 [local rate], fax 020 7973 6283 [national rate], or email west.live@bbc.co.uk.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from the BBC. Followed by regional news and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Snooker: UK Championships
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Quarter final action continues at the UK Championships in York, where former UK Champions Steve Davis and John Parrott, join Ray Stubbs to offer their unique insight into this prestigious event.

BasicDescription.Title: The Simpsons
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Summer Of Four: On vacation at the beach Lisa plays dumb to make friends with some 'cool' kids, leaving an envious Bart all burned up, with Milhouse as his only comrade.

BasicDescription.Title: TOTP2
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Join Steve Wright for his regular trawl through the dressing up box of pop, with exclusives from the Rolling Stones and Dionne Warwick.

BasicDescription.Title: Snooker: UK Championships
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Hazel Irvine introduces live coverage of the second session of today's quarter finals. Matches are the best-of-17 frames and the winners are guaranteed at least �21,700 in prize money.

BasicDescription.Title: Time Flyers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: In Search Of Offa's Dyke: On one side of the River Severn, the dyke approaches the banks but disappears just short of the river. It reappears 5 miles downstream. So where is the missing stretch?

In Search Of Offa's Dyke
Offa's Dyke is the largest ancient monument in Britain. It was built in the Dark Ages by the ruthless Saxon king, King Offa, to mark the 130 kilometre boundary between England and Wales. A bank was created that reached over two metres, with an accompanying ditch which was, at points, twenty metres wide.
But mystery surrounds a stretch of the dyke at Welshpool. On one side of the River Severn, the dyke approaches the banks but disappears just short of the river. It reappears on the other side - but five miles downstream. So where is the missing stretch of Dyke? Using the helicopter and an ambitious reconstruction of the dyke, Time Flyers sets out to solve the mystery.

BasicDescription.Title: Life Laundry
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Kate In Croydon: Busy single mother Kate, whose house is packed with children's prams, clothes, toys and gifts from friends, is forced to regain some valuable living space.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Book: The Life Laundry: How to De-Junk Your Life

BasicDescription.Title: Gary Rhodes' Cookery Year
BasicDescription.Synopsis: February: Gary Rhodes concludes his series with fabulous recipes for February using the best seasonal ingredients.

Gary Rhodes concludes his series with fabulous recipes for February.
Using the best seasonal ingredients, Gary dishes up steamed chicken leg jardiniere, john dory with raisin and thyme onions, and spicy comice pudding with hot chocolate sauce.

BasicDescription.Title: Reputations
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Marie Antoinette: Renowned as a frivolous woman who epitomized the decadence of the French monarchy, her infamous line, 'let them eat cake,' was something she never said. Strong language.

Marie-Antoinette has gone down in history as a callous, frivolous woman who epitomized the decadence of the French monarchy, paying the ultimate price at the guillotine. But her most famous line, 'Let them eat cake,' was something she never actually said.
Reputations reveals how the Austrian-born queen was hated by the French from the start, and how her unconsummated marriage to the undersexed Louis XVI led her to seek comfort in frivolity. Yet despite accusations of nymphomania and even bestiality, she tried hard to be a loving wife and in adversity she impressed even her enemies with her dignity and courage.
This is the very human tragedy of a flawed but caring woman who, as revolution swept her adopted country, became a prime example of the wrong person in the wrong place at the wrong time.

BasicDescription.Title: Babyfather
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Johnny goes to court to gain access to his son, Tarjan, while Linvall's son's behaviour gives him cause for concern.

BasicDescription.Title: Newsnight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: In-depth investigation and analysis of the stories behind the day's headlines.

BasicDescription.Title: Snooker: UK Championships
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The first two quarter finals in this year's UK Championship are played to a conclusion tonight. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the best-of-17 frame encounters.
